alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Monroe; Vernon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 15 at 9:23PM CST until December 15 at 9:45PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CST FOR SOUTHERN CLARK...CENTRAL JACKSON...NORTHEASTERN VERNON AND MONROE COUNTIES... At 923 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Sheldon to near Colby to 10 miles southeast of Shortville, moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Clark, central Jackson, northeastern Vernon and Monroe Counties, including the following locations...Potters Flowage, Lynn, Glendale and Trippville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for central, southwestern and west central Wisconsin. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
